definition: suffix of a noun of locality
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes

sentences.english: Bilateral trade has expanded 1500-fold in the past 42 years.
sentences.chinese: 42年来，中澳双边贸易规模扩大了1500多倍。

sentences.english: And we agreed that it is not just bilateral trade that matters.
sentences.chinese: 双方同意，发挥重要作用的不仅仅是双边贸易。

sentences.english: The economies of China and the E.U. have much to offer each other and our two-way trade holds a huge potential.
sentences.chinese: 中欧两个经济体互补性很强，双边贸易潜力巨大。

sentences.english: According to Chinese statistics, our two-way trade volume reached US$74.2 billion last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年双边贸易按中方计算达到742亿美元。

sentences.english: The schematic shows the bilateral trade statistics between China and Afghanistan.
sentences.chinese: 图为中阿双边贸易统计图表。

sentences.english: The bulk of the trade between the two sides has been investment-driven trade.
sentences.chinese: 双边贸易的大部分是投资驱动型的贸易。

sentences.english: In recent years, Sino-Australian bilateral trade maintained rapid growth.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，中澳双边贸易保持快速增长。

sentences.english: The picture shows the main commodities in Sino-Australian bilateral trade.
sentences.chinese: 图为中澳双边贸易主要商品。

sentences.english: China and the United States concluded [entered into] a bilateral trade agreement after long negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 中美两国通过长期谈判后订立了一项双边贸易协定。

pinyin: wai4 shang1 zhi2 jie1 tou2 zi1
